titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5055, ENERGY AND WATER DEVELOPMENT AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5055, ENERGY AND WATER DEVELOPMENT AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 82

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Clawson (FL) amendment that seeks to increase funding, by offset, for Army Corps of Engineers, Construction, by $50,000,000;<P/>McNerney amendment that seeks to strike General Provisions, Department of the Interior, related to California state water projects;<P/>Griffith amendment that seeks to reduce the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Program by $50,000,000, and increase the Fossil Energy Research and Development Program by $45,000,000;<P/>Buck amendment that seeks to zero out the accounts for Plant or Facility Acquisition, Construction, or Expansion of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Programs and apply the $3,481,616,000 in savings to the Spending Reduction Account;<P/>Polis amendment that seeks to increase funds for Energy efficiency and renewable energy by $9,750,000 and decrease funds for fossil energy research and development by $13,000,000;<P/>Polis amendment that seeks to zero out the Fossil Energy Research and Development fund and apply the $285,000,000 in savings to the spending reduction account;<P/>Weber (TX) amendment that seeks to zero out the Innovative Technology Guarantee program and apply the $7,000,000 in savings to the spending reduction account;<P/>Welch amendment that seeks to increase funding, by offset, for the Northern Border Regional Commission, by $2,500,000;<P/>Ellison amendment that seeks to redirect $1,000,000 in funding within Departmental Administration, Department of Energy;<P/>Farr amendment (No. 1 printed in the Congressional Record of May 23, 2016) that seeks to strike section 506 pertaining to the further implementation of the coastal and marine spatial planning and ecosystem-based management components of the National Ocean Policy; and<P/>Garamendi amendment that seeks to prohibit the use of funds to expand plutonium pit production capacity at the PF-4 facility at Los Alamos National Laboratory.<P/>H. Res. 743, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5055) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 237 yeas to 171 nays, Roll No. 232, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 174 nays, Roll No. 231.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Clawson (FL) amendment that seeks to increase funding, by offset, for Army Corps of Engineers, Construction, by $50,000,000;<P/>McNerney amendment that seeks to strike General Provisions, Department of the Interior, related to California state water projects;<P/>Griffith amendment that seeks to reduce the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Program by $50,000,000, and increase the Fossil Energy Research and Development Program by $45,000,000;<P/>Buck amendment that seeks to zero out the accounts for Plant or Facility Acquisition, Construction, or Expansion of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy Programs and apply the $3,481,616,000 in savings to the Spending Reduction Account;<P/>Polis amendment that seeks to increase funds for Energy efficiency and renewable energy by $9,750,000 and decrease funds for fossil energy research and development by $13,000,000;<P/>Polis amendment that seeks to zero out the Fossil Energy Research and Development fund and apply the $285,000,000 in savings to the spending reduction account;<P/>Weber (TX) amendment that seeks to zero out the Innovative Technology Guarantee program and apply the $7,000,000 in savings to the spending reduction account;<P/>Welch amendment that seeks to increase funding, by offset, for the Northern Border Regional Commission, by $2,500,000;<P/>Ellison amendment that seeks to redirect $1,000,000 in funding within Departmental Administration, Department of Energy;<P/>Farr amendment (No. 1 printed in the Congressional Record of May 23, 2016) that seeks to strike section 506 pertaining to the further implementation of the coastal and marine spatial planning and ecosystem-based management components of the National Ocean Policy; and<P/>Garamendi amendment that seeks to prohibit the use of funds to expand plutonium pit production capacity at the PF-4 facility at Los Alamos National Laboratory.<P/>H. Res. 743, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5055) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 237 yeas to 171 nays, Roll No. 232, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 174 nays, Roll No. 231.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 2576, TSCA MODERNIZATION ACT OF 2015, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 897, REDUCING REGULATORY BURDENS ACT OF 2015

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 2576, TSCA MODERNIZATION ACT OF 2015, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 897, REDUCING REGULATORY BURDENS ACT OF 2015; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 82

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Toxic Substances Control Act Modernization Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-54, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 114-590, in lieu of the matter proposed to be inserted by the Senate, to H.R. 2576, to modernize the Toxic Substances Control Act, by a yea-and-nay vote of 403 yeas to 12 nays, Roll No. 238.<P/>H. Res. 742, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2576) and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. D573897) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 171 noes, Roll No. 234, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 175 nays, Roll No. 233.

The House passed H.R. 897, to amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify Congressional intent regarding the regulation of the use of pesticides in or near navigable waters, by a recorded vote of 258 ayes to 156 noes, Roll No. 237.<P/>Rejected the Ruiz motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 182 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 236.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-53 shall be considered as adopted.<P/>H. Res. 742, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2576) and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 897) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 171 noes, Roll No. 234, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 175 nays, Roll No. 233.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Toxic Substances Control Act Modernization Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the motion to concur in the Senate amendment with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-54, modified by the amendment printed in H. Rept. 114-590, in lieu of the matter proposed to be inserted by the Senate, to H.R. 2576, to modernize the Toxic Substances Control Act, by a yea-and-nay vote of 403 yeas to 12 nays, Roll No. 238.<P/>H. Res. 742, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2576) and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. D573897) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 171 noes, Roll No. 234, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 175 nays, Roll No. 233.

The House passed H.R. 897, to amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify Congressional intent regarding the regulation of the use of pesticides in or near navigable waters, by a recorded vote of 258 ayes to 156 noes, Roll No. 237.<P/>Rejected the Ruiz motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 182 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 236.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-53 shall be considered as adopted.<P/>H. Res. 742, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2576) and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 897) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 171 noes, Roll No. 234, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 175 nays, Roll No. 233.

titleInfo.title: INTELLIGENCE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017

extension.searchTitle: INTELLIGENCE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 82

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure which was debated on Monday, May 23rd:<P/>H.R. 5077, amended, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 371 yeas to 35 nays with 1 answering ``present'', Roll No. 235.

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 897, to amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify Congressional intent regarding the regulation of the use of pesticides in or near navigable waters, by a recorded vote of 258 ayes to 156 noes, Roll No. 237.<P/>Rejected the Ruiz motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 182 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 236.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-53 shall be considered as adopted.

The House passed H.R. 897, to amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify Congressional intent regarding the regulation of the use of pesticides in or near navigable waters, by a recorded vote of 258 ayes to 156 noes, Roll No. 237.

The House passed H.R. 897, to amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to clarify Congressional intent regarding the regulation of the use of pesticides in or near navigable waters, by a recorded vote of 258 ayes to 156 noes, Roll No. 237.<P/>Rejected the Ruiz motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 182 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 236.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-53 shall be considered as adopted.

congVote.result: The joint resolution (H.J. Res. 88) was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 56 yeas to 41 nays (Vote No. 84), Senate passed H. J.Res. 88, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to the definition of the term ``Fiduciary'', after agreeing to the motion to proceed.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Secretary of Agriculture Fish Inspection Rule_Agreement
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of S. J.Res. 28, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Secretary of Agriculture relating to inspection of fish of the order Siluriformes.<P/>By 57 yeas to 40 nays (Vote No. 85), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.
